With Microsoft Outlook? Express, you can easily import items, such as address book data, from other programs, including other mail clients. For more information, see this how-to article. Work Offline with Outlook Express Learn how to configure Outlook Express so you can read and compose messages offline, which can save you time and money. Developers For Developers Learn more about how to develop rich Web-based applications using the Internet Explorer programming model that includes support for the Extensible Markup Language (XML) and enhanced Dynamic HTML features. Newsgroups Join peer-to-peer discussions about Internet Explorer issues and solutions.
Outlook Express lets you arrange your e-mail messages using folders. Learn how to save, delete, create, and move folders to stay organized with your e-mail messages.

Internet Explorer 6 helps you safeguard your family's browsing experience with Content Advisor, which blocks access to sites with objectionable content. Find out how to activate it so you can rest easier.

Internet Explorer 6 includes many new and enhanced features to help you work faster on the Web, while also helping you maintain the security and privacy of your personal information. Start learning about the features in Internet Explorer 6 that can help make your online experience secure.

Before you can use Outlook? Express to send and receive e-mail, you need to set up an account. You can have more than one account-for business, online shopping, and so on-and each person who uses your computer may have their own, completely separate account. Outlook Express gracefully handles it all.
The new Media Bar makes it easy to find and play media files in the Internet Explorer 6 window. Learn how to customize the Media Bar to enhance your browsing experience

The AutoComplete feature in Internet Explorer automatically remembers information that you've recently typed, such as Web addresses, information in forms, and search queries. You save time because you don't have to type in the full information?just select AutoComplete's match and go!
Learn about the Temporary Internet Files folder, also known as the cache, and how clearing your cache can improve browsing speed and help optimize the space on your hard disk.
Internet Explorer 6 lets you easily save, print, or e-mail pictures that you find on the Web with the new Image Toolbar feature.

Is there a site that you visit every time you browse the Web? If so, you can set it as your home page. That way, it will appear every time you start Internet Explorer or click the Home button on the Internet Explorer toolbar.

With Internet Explorer 6, it's easy to change your Web browsing layout to suit the way you work. Learn how to add and remove buttons on the toolbar, increase Web page viewing space, and create a custom toolbar layout.

Tracking down the information that you're looking for on the Web is just a click away with Internet Explorer's built-in search feature Search Companion. Search Companion makes searching the Internet faster and simpler than ever.

Automatic Image Resizing makes it easier to work with large pictures on the Internet. If pictures are too big to display in your browser window, Internet Explorer can automatically resize the picture to fit. Find out how.
Internet Explorer uses its Favorites list to put Web sites you visit often within easy reach. That way, you don't have to remember or type anything. Just click your mouse twice?and there you are.

Have you ever printed a Web page, only to find that you had printed not one, but ten pages? Or printed a page with a background so dark you couldn't read the text, and had wasted printer ink, too? You can solve these problems if you preview before you print

The Internet Explorer History list makes it easy to find and return to Web sites and pages you've visited in the past. Whether it's today or a few weeks ago, the History list can record every page you visit, so it's easy to go back later on.

Just getting started online? Want to learn more about how to use Internet Explorer to work faster on the Web? Check out our how-to articles to get the most out of your Web browsing experience. Learn the basics on finding Web pages and building up your Favorites, then move on to customizing features, setting security and privacy preferences, and more. Advanced users can get more information in our section for developers.

Read how-to articles to learn how to customize Internet Explorer features to help you work smarter and faster on the Web. You can also join a newsgroup to share information with other Internet Explorer users.
Find out what it takes to run Internet Explorer 6.
Learn more about the Internet Explorer 6 features that help to simplify the daily tasks that you perform online while helping you to maintain the privacy of your personal information on the Web.
Find out what other Internet Explorer users are downloading with this list of most popular downloads.
It's hot and it's here. Get more play, your way with the new Microsoft Windows Media? Player 9 Series.
Get a quick overview of the features and technologies that make Internet Explorer 6 a private, reliable, and flexible Internet browsing experience.
This friendly, high-energy guide by Kathy Ivens makes it easy to teach yourself exactly what you need.
Find tips and tricks on cameras, photography, and digital imaging.
Plus! Digital Media Edition delivers exciting new ways to enjoy your photos, music, and home movies with Windows XP.
Explore newsgroups, community columns, and chats in the Windows XP Expert Zone Community.
Get free game downloads: card games, puzzles, word and trivia teasers, kids' games, and more.

Music and Video, Movies, Instant Communication, and Digital Photos With the features in Microsoft Windows? XP you can make movies, enjoy your favorite music and videos whenever you like, exchange instant messages with friends and family, work with digital photos, and more
Now that you know how Internet Explorer 6 helps you get the most from the Web, it's time to create your own personal Web site.
Meet the Anderson family and see how they use Internet Explorer 6 for everyday work and play. Then watch more how-to videos.
Take full advantage of Outlook Express. Set up an account so you can check e-mail and participate in Internet newsgroups
It's easy to set up Internet Explorer the way you want so the features you use most are just a click away.
See how easy it is to control your security and privacy settings with Internet Explorer so you can help protect your whole family wherever you go on the Web.
Make Internet Explorer work harder so you can work smarter. Get some quick tips on organizing Favorites, using Web History, and working with your pictures on the Web

Whether you use the Web to read news, get e-mail, shop, or play music and videos, Internet Explorer 6 makes it fast, easy, and fun for you to get the most from the Web while helping to keep your family safe online. Discover what you can do with these how-to articles and videos.
Experience the best of the Web the way you want with the latest version of Internet Explorer
Use Google search to find the exact message you want, no matter when it was sent or received
Keep it all in context. Each message is grouped with all its replies and displayed as a conversation. No pop-up ads. No untargeted banners.
Don't throw anything away. 1000 megabytes of free storage so you'll never need to delete another message.
